abstract: A congressman asks Amazon some questions about the Kindle Fire and privacy.
snippet: A congressman asks Amazon some questions about the Kindle Fire and privacy.
lead_paragraph: The dream of every retailer is to know exactly what its customers are thinking. Are they comparison-shopping? Just looking? Will a discount help close the deal? Or is price no object? Amazon's coming tablet, the Kindle Fire, is equipped with a Web browser that, thanks to the wonders of cloud computing, is partly housed on Amazon's servers. That will give the retailer opportunities to track customer behavior all over the Web, gathering data and marketing intelligence as it goes.

headline.main: Questions for Amazon on Privacy and the Kindle Fire
